main event: A bright, elongated light was observed by a civilian in Dexter, Maine on August 3, 1956. The object did not conform to the characteristics of a normal aircraft.
interesting points: The object was described as a single, bright, elongated light.
The object appeared to be an aircraft but did not behave like a normal aircraft.
The Air Force concluded the sighting was possibly a balloon, astronomical meteor, aircraft, or astronomical star/planet, but the cause was unknown.

The Air Force requested a complete report be submitted in accordance with Air Force regulations and that the University of Maine Observatory be checked to determine if they saw the object and if it was of astronomical origin.
